definition: a port for external trade/a trading or transit post on border between countries
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
treaty port, forced on Qing China by the 19th century Great Powers

sentences.english: Shanghai was one of the first five treaty ports in modern China.

sentences.english: The inauguration ceremony for the new Hengqin Port Joint Inspection Complex Building was ceremoniously held on the morning of December 8th.

sentences.english: It also examines the relationship between foreign and domestic grains at the trading port level.
